thread.title: The I.C.S. Bill

author: tribuneindia.com
title: The I.C.S. Bill
text: THE volume of opinion against the I.C.S. Bill is growing. Indians of all classes are united in this matter. The latest telegram makes the case worse than was at first presumed. What the Bill proposed is that three-fourths of the number of appointments should be filled by nomination from amongst deserving soldiers (Europeans) and the remaining one-fourth of the appointments thrown open to competition both by Europeans and Indians. Lord Islington says that the "Indian proportion will not suffer and that if with the examination of one-fourth there was not a result the same proportion of Indians successful as in former years that number should e made up by selection."
